Title: Verify Text Mode Access
Description/User Story: Verify that the Fire Desk (Text Mode) is accessible and displays airspace and range data in tabular format.
Preconditions: User logged in as Fire Desk operator.
Test Steps: 1. Log in to the RFMSS application.
Expected Results: Fire Desk (Text Mode) is displayed with airspace and range data in tabular format.
Test Data: Logged in as Fire Desk Operator (FDO)

Test Steps: 2. Navigate to Operations > Fire Desk (Text Mode).

Title: Verify Data Interaction in Text Mode
Description/User Story: Verify that users can interact with data (e.g., sorting, filtering) in Fire Desk (Text Mode).
Test Steps: 1. Sort and filter data in Fire Desk (Text Mode).
Expected Results: Data interaction functionalities (sorting, filtering) are available and work correctly.

Title: Verify Graphics Mode Access
Description/User Story: Verify that the Fire Desk (Graphics Mode) is accessible and displays range maps and data graphically.
Preconditions: User logged in as Fire Desk operator.
Test Steps: 1. Log in to the RFMSS application.
Expected Results: Fire Desk (Graphics Mode) is displayed with range maps and data graphically.
Test Data: Logged in as Fire Desk operator

Test Steps: 2. Navigate to Operations > Fire Desk (Graphics Mode).

Title: Verify GIS Functionality in Graphics Mode
Description/User Story: Verify that users can use GIS functionalities (e.g., zoom, pan) in Fire Desk (Graphics Mode).
Test Steps: 1. Use GIS functionalities such as zoom and pan in Fire Desk (Graphics Mode).
Expected Results: GIS functionalities (zoom, pan) are available and work correctly.

Title: Verify Incident Reporting
Description/User Story: Verify that Fire Desk operators can create incident reports and select incident types.
Preconditions: User logged in as Fire Desk operator.
Test Steps: 1. Log in to the RFMSS application.
Expected Results: Incident report is created successfully and incident type can be selected from the list.

Test Steps: 2. Navigate to Operations > Incident Reporting.
3. Create a new incident report and select incident type.

Title: Verify Report Generation (Text Mode)
Description/User Story: Verify that operators can generate reports from Fire Desk (Text Mode).
Preconditions: User logged in as Fire Desk operator.
Test Steps: 1. Log in to the RFMSS application.
Expected Results: Reports are generated correctly from Fire Desk (Text Mode).

Test Steps: 2. Navigate to Operations > Fire Desk (Text Mode).
3. Generate report based on specific filters.

Title: Verify Report Generation (Graphics Mode)
Description/User Story: Verify that operators can generate reports from Fire Desk (Graphics Mode).
Preconditions: User logged in as Fire Desk operator.
Test Steps: 1. Log in to the RFMSS application.
Expected Results: Reports are generated correctly from Fire Desk (Graphics Mode).

Test Steps: 2. Navigate to Operations > Fire Desk (Graphics Mode).
3. Generate report based on specific filters.

Title: Verify Fire Desk Configuration
Description/User Story: Verify that FA can configure Fire Desk settings such as displayed columns, DODICs visibility, and incident types.
Test Steps: 1. Log in as FA.
Expected Results: Fire Desk settings are configured correctly, and changes are saved and applied.

Test Steps: 2. Navigate to Administration > Fire Desk Configuration.
3. Configure settings (columns, DODICs, incidents).

Title: Verify User Assignment to Fire Desk
Description/User Story: Verify that FA can assign RFMSS users to a Fire Desk.
Test Steps: 1. Log in as FA.
Expected Results: Users are successfully assigned to the specified Fire Desk.

Test Steps: 2. Navigate to Administration > Fire Desk Users.
3. Assign users to a specific Fire Desk.

Title: Verify Communication Log Setup
Description/User Story: Verify that FA can define and display column titles and widths on the Communication Log.
Test Steps: 1. Log in as FA.
Expected Results: Communication Log columns are defined and displayed correctly.

Test Steps: 2. Navigate to Administration > Fire Desk Communication Log.
3. Define column titles and widths.

Title: Verify Same Day Request
Description/User Story: Verify that users can submit same day requests if permitted.
Preconditions: User permissions allowing same day requests.
Test Steps: 1. Log in.
Expected Results: Same day request is successfully submitted and listed in the system.

Test Steps: 2. Navigate to Scheduling > Same Day Request.
3. Submit a same day request.
